tagItem.name: REM
tagItem.description: REM: Rapid Eye Movements, sawtooth waves, transient muscle activity, LAMF EEG without sleep spindes or K-complexes

tagItem.name: 1 N1
tagItem.description: LAMF activity in the 2-7 Hz range.

tagItem.name: 2 N2
tagItem.description: N2: sleep spindles and/or K-complexes unassociated with arousals

tagItem.name: 3 N3
tagItem.description: more than 20% of the epoch consists of Slow wave activity: 0.5--2Hz, p2p>75 µV.

tagItem.name: M movements
tagItem.description: Major body movement: movement and muscle artifact obscuring EEG for more than half an epoch to the extent that sleep stage cannot be determined.

tagItem.name: A
tagItem.description: Atrifact (5 blocks per page, all channels)

tagItem.name: Sleep spindle
tagItem.description: The presence of a sleep spindle should not be defined unless it is at least 0.5 sec duration, i.e. one should be able to count 6 or 7 distinct waves within the half-second period. The term should be used only to describe activity between 12 and 14 Hz.

tagItem.name: L sLow Wave
tagItem.description: Slow Wave Activity: waves of frequency 0.5-2 Hz and p2p amplitude >75 µV, measured over frontal regions referenced to the contralateral ear or mastoid (F4-M1, F3-M2).

tagItem.name: K complex
tagItem.description: K complex: a well-delineated, negative, sharp wave immediately followed by a positive component standing out K complexes are defined as EEG wave forms having a well delineated negative sharp wave which is immediately folowed by a positive component. The total duration of the complex should not exceed 0.5 sec.

tagItem.name: Vertex sharp wave
tagItem.description: Vertex sharp wave: sharply contoured waves with duration <0.5 seconds, maxima over the central region and distinguished from the background activity.

tagItem.name: T sawtooth waves
tagItem.description: Sawtooth wave: pattern consisting of trains of sharply contoured or triangular, often serrated, 2-6 Hz waves maximal in amplitude over the central head regions and often, but not always, preceding a burst of rapid eye movements.

tagItem.name: P alPha
tagItem.description: Alpha rhythm: pattern consisting of trains of sinusoidal 8-13 Hz activity recorded over the occipital region with eye closure and attenuating with eye opening.
